alert.note: Alert for Inland St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 3:50PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern St. Lucie County through 415 PM EDT... At 350 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong shower 10 miles northwest of Tradition, or 13 miles west of White City, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and funnel clouds. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern St. Lucie County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
